data.title: Jazz at the NCMA presents An Evening with Babyface
data.meta_description: The NCMA welcomes 12-time Grammy Award–winning recording artist, songwriter, and producer Babyface for a special evening of R&B and soul.
data.text:
The NCMA welcomes 12-time Grammy Award–winning recording artist, songwriter, and producer Babyface for a special evening of R&B and soul.

About Babyface

Babyface is one of the most celebrated creative forces in music history. He is the only person to win the Grammy’s Producer of the Year category four times, three times in consecutive years (1995–97), a record he holds to this day. Babyface has contributed to over 800 million records sold and over a billion records streamed. He has produced and written 125 Top 10 hits, 45 No. 1 R&B hits, and 16 No. 1 pop hits. In addition to winning a total of 12 Grammys, he has been nominated 83 times.

Babyface is also co-founder of the legendary record label LaFace, which launched the careers of artists such as Usher, Toni Braxton, TLC, Outkast, and Pink.

Photo: Courtesy of P Music Group

Musician photo and recording policy

No flash or professional photography allowed. No video or audio recording of any kind allowed.

No smoking allowed inside venue gates.

Concert policies and answers to frequently asked questions

Venue map

Get the latest information delivered to your phone! If there’s bad weather or any other issue, we’ll send a text. (We promise not to send annoying, frequent message, just useful updates. Standard rates apply. Reply STOP at any time to opt out.) To join, text NCMABabyface2024 to (866) 603-4250.

Do you or a family member need a general accommodation for your visit? Contact the visitor experience team at help@ncartmuseum.org.

The NCMA offers various types of accessibility accommodations for all types of programming, tours, and events. To request an accommodation or find out what is available, please contact Accessibility and Inclusion Coordinator Molly Hull at mailto:mhull@ncartmuseum.org. Please note that requests require a minimum of two weeks’ notice.

Presented by

NCMA Jazz Pass

Through Thursday, May 16, 2024, or while tickets are available

All Jazz at the NCMA tickets must be purchased at one time; discount applies to both member and nonmember pricing.

Purchasers who buy tickets to three or four Jazz at the NCMA concerts at ONE TIME receive 15% off per ticket

Purchasers who buy tickets to five or six Jazz at the NCMA concerts at ONE TIME receive 20% off per ticket

Purchasers who buy tickets to all seven Jazz at the NCMA concerts at ONE TIME receive 25% off per ticket
